data.text: Node for ‘Data’, ‘Chart’, “Modeling’, ‘Output’ and ‘Model Evaluation’. Data loading (data input), data manipulation to filter, derive variables and define indep. & dep. variables.

The resource window displays with Local, Model, and Output. Local displays the list of the current working folder. Model stores the current data analytical node. Output stores the results of executing the current project.
The window displays the contents of the selected menu (Local, Model, Output) in the Resource menu.
Working space for data handling and model configuration
Information for data and model specification and output at each node
Log messages about errors and process information
The help for the node properties

tables.table_html:
Num. Window name Description
(1) Menu Creating/editing/saving project and files
(2) Node Node for ‘Data’, ‘Chart’, “Modeling’, ‘Output’ and ‘Model Evaluation’. Data loading (data input), data manipulation to filter, derive variables and define indep. & dep. variables.
(3) ResourceWindow Resource Menu The resource window displays with Local, Model, and Output. Local displays the list of the current working folder. Model stores the current data analytical node. Output stores the results of executing the current project.
(4) ResourceList The window displays the contents of the selected menu (Local, Model, Output) in the Resource menu.
(5) Workspace Working space for data handling and model configuration
(6) Node Property Information for data and model specification and output at each node
(7) Message Log messages about errors and process information
(8) Dynamic Help The help for the node properties

anchors.text: Node for ‘Data’, ‘Chart’, “Modeling’, ‘Output’ and ‘Model Evaluation’. Data loading (data input), data manipulation to filter, derive variables and define indep. & dep. variables.

The resource window displays with Local, Model, and Output. Local displays the list of the current working folder. Model stores the current data analytical node. Output stores the results of executing the current project.
The window displays the contents of the selected menu (Local, Model, Output) in the Resource menu.

data.text: Frequently used nodes. Add or exclude in ‘Most used nodes’ in Tool’s options
Data manipulation nodes for filtering, sorting, and splitting.
Analytical techniques for prediction, classification, clustering, and AI algorithms

tables.table_html:
Classification Description
Most used nodes Frequently used nodes. Add or exclude in ‘Most used nodes’ in Tool’s options
Input Node Load data
Preprocessing Node Data manipulation nodes for filtering, sorting, and splitting.
Chart Node Graphics for data visualization
Modeling Node Analytical techniques for prediction, classification, clustering, and AI algorithms
Output Node Save a DB or file
Model Evaluation Node Model evaluation, ROC chart

anchors.text: Frequently used nodes. Add or exclude in ‘Most used nodes’ in Tool’s options

data.text: Displays all types of files specified in the ECMiner™ options.

tables.table_html:
ICON Description
[image:rId93] [image:rId94] Displays all types of files specified in the ECMiner™ options.
[image:rId95] [image:rId96] Data files, which are *.ecl files.
[image:rId97] [image:rId98] Model files (*.gms) created in ECMiner™.
[image:rId99] [image:rId100] ECMiner™ project files (*.ecm).

anchors.text: Displays all types of files specified in the ECMiner™ options.

data.text: NOTE Since the output of the Display Node is generated as data, it should be saved as a data file(*.ecl) rather than as an output file (*.ept). Therefore, you must use the save button within the Display Node screen to save the output. [image:rId121]

tables.table_html: NOTE Since the output of the Display Node is generated as data, it should be saved as a data file(*.ecl) rather than as an output file (*.ept). Therefore, you must use the save button within the Display Node screen to save the output. [image:rId121]

anchors.text: NOTE Since the output of the Display Node is generated as data, it should be saved as a data file(*.ecl) rather than as an output file (*.ept). Therefore, you must use the save button within the Display Node screen to save the output. [image:rId121]

tables.preceding_text: The types of messages can be categorized into five categories, differentiated by color as follows:
tables.table_html:
Num. color content
1 General Message
2 Emphasized message.
3 General Error Message
4 Critical Error Message
5 Note Message

tables.preceding_text:
When you edit a node’s properties, a brief description of the selected property will be shown in the Dynamic Help section.
The toolbar provides following functions:

data.text: NOTE If the mouse is released outside of the direction icon, the control window will open independently. The position of the workspace cannot be changed.

tables.table_html: NOTE If the mouse is released outside of the direction icon, the control window will open independently. The position of the workspace cannot be changed.

anchors.text: NOTE If the mouse is released outside of the direction icon, the control window will open independently. The position of the workspace cannot be changed.

tables.preceding_text: The shortcut key is shown in the table. F5 is for ‘execute’ and Ctrl & S is for ‘save’ and so on.
tables.table_html:
Shortcut function Shortcut function
Ctrl + N New Alt + V, T Toolbar
Ctrl + O Open Alt + V, T, S Standard Toolbar
Ctrl + S Save Alt + V, T, N Node
Ctrl + P Print Alt + V, T, P Node Properties
F5 Execute Alt + V, T, E Resource Window
Shift + F5 Stop Execution Alt + V, T, H Dynamic Help
Ctrl + F5 Part Execute Alt + V, S Status Bar
Alt + P Project Alt + V, E Data Browser
Alt + P, N New Alt + S Stream
Alt + P, O Open Alt + S, A Add Node
Alt + P, C Close Alt + S, C Connect Upon Creating Node
Alt + P, S Save Alt + S, N Connect
Alt + P, A Save As Alt + S, L Disconnect
Alt + P, P Print Alt + S, R Execute
Alt + P, V Print Preview Alt + S, S Stop Execution
Alt + P, R Print Setting Alt + S, N Part Execute
Alt + P, X Exit Alt + T Tool
Alt + E Edit Alt + T, O Option
Alt + E, T Cut Alt + T, I Initialize Program Environment
Alt + E, C Copy Alt + W Window
Alt + E, P Paste Alt + W, C Cascade Alignment
Alt + E, D Delete Alt + W, T Grid Alignment
Alt + V View Alt + H Help
Alt + V, T, M Message Alt + H, A ECMiner™ Info

Set the default driver and login information for ODBC or OLE DB.

anchors.text: Set the program defaults for Date/Time Format, Reading Data, Designate File Extensions to Display on Resource Window, Program Look, etc.
Set the default driver and login information for ODBC or OLE DB.
You can add or delete the most used nodes.

data.text: You select the date/time display format based on the language.
Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.

Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.
Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.

tables.table_html:
Num. description
(1) You select the date/time display format based on the language.
(2) Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.
(3) Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.
(4) Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
(5) Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.

anchors.text: You select the date/time display format based on the language.
Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.

Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.
Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.

data.text: Enter the database connection information for nodes related to OLE DB.
Enter the database connection information for nodes related to ODBC.
Selecting this option will automatically fill in the database connection information when adding nodes related to the database.

tables.table_html:
Num. description
(1) Enter the database connection information for nodes related to OLE DB.
(2) Enter the database connection information for nodes related to ODBC.
(3) Selecting this option will automatically fill in the database connection information when adding nodes related to the database.

anchors.text: Enter the database connection information for nodes related to OLE DB.

data.text: All nodes supported by ECMiner™ are listed.
(1) is used to add the selected node to "Most used nodes".
To remove a node from "Most used nodes," select the node to be removed at (4) and press this button.
This is the current list of nodes added to "Most used nodes."
